Url.Abstract: Deploy SQLcompliance Agent Wizard SQLcompliance Agent Service Account This window allows you to specify the credentials of the Windows user account under which the SQLcompliance Agent Service runs. The SQLcompliance Agent Service uses this account to stop and start SQL Server traces, execute stored procedures, manage trace files, and communicate with the Collection Server. Ensure you specify a valid Windows account that has SQL Server System Administrator privileges on the target SQL Server instance.

Url.Title: Deploy SQLcompliance Agent Wizard Summary
Url.Abstract: Deploy SQLcompliance Agent Wizard Summary Review the provided summary, and then click Finish. When you finish this wizard, SQL Compliance Manager installs the SQLcompliance Agent on the computer that hosts the selected SQL Server instance, and starts the SQLcompliance Agent Service.

Url.Title: Deploy SQLcompliance Agent Wizard SQLcompliance Agent Trace Directory
Url.Abstract: Deploy SQLcompliance Agent Wizard SQLcompliance Agent Trace Directory This window allows you to accept the default path for the agent trace directory or specify a different path. The default path is C:\Program Files\Idera\SQLcompliance\AgentTraceFiles, and is secured using ACL settings. The SQLcompliance Agent stores SQL Server trace files in this directory until the files can be sent to the Collection Server.

Url.Title: Deploy Reports Wizard Connect to Reporting Services
Url.Abstract: Deploy Reports Wizard Connect to Reporting Services This tab allows you to specify the Report Server to which you want to deploy the SQL Compliance Manager Reports. The Deploy Reports wizard automatically applies connection settings based on a default Microsoft Reporting Services installation. You can use the default connection settings, or specify custom connection settings.

Url.Title: Deploy Reports Wizard
Url.Abstract: Deploy Reports Wizard Report Deployment Location This tab allows you to specify the name of the folder where the reports should be stored. This folder belongs to the Virtual Directory specified in the Reporting Services connection settings, and is displayed when you access the reports using the Report Manager interface.

Url.Title: Deploy Reports Wizard SQL compliance manager Repository
Url.Abstract: Deploy Reports Wizard SQL Compliance Manager Repository This tab allows you to specify which Windows user account SQL Compliance Manager should use to connect to the Repository. You can use the same account that the Collection Service runs under, or you can specify a different account.

Url.Title: Deploy Reports Wizard Summary
Url.Abstract: Deploy Reports Wizard Summary Review the provided summary, and then click Finish. When you finish this wizard, SQL Compliance Manager installs the corresponding RDL files in the specified virtual directory on your Report Server.

Url.Title: Deploy Reports Wizard
Url.Abstract: Deploy Reports Wizard Welcome You can deploy the SQL Compliance Manager Reports to your existing Microsoft Reporting Services installation. SQL CM supports Reporting Services version 2005 or later. If you previously deployed SQL Compliance Manager Reports, verify which version of Reporting Services is currently running in your environment.

Url.Title: Edit Data Alert Rule Wizard
Url.Abstract: Edit Data Alert Rule Wizard Alert Actions This tab allows you to change the action you want this alert rule to perform when an audited data matches the specified criteria. Depending on the actions you select, SQL Compliance Manager will write an alert message to the application event log and email it to a specific email address or distribution list. You can use the default alert message or customize it to display the information you need most.

Url.Title: Edit Data Alert Rule Wizard
Url.Abstract: Edit Data Alert Rule Wizard Data Alert Type This tab allows you to change the criteria of this alert rule by editing its parameters in the Edit rule details pane.

Url.Title: Edit Data Alert Rule Wizard
Url.Abstract: Edit Data Alert Rule Wizard Finish Alert Rule Use the rule details pane to review your changes, and then click Finish. When you finish this wizard, SQL Compliance Manager applies your changes.

Url.Title: Edit Data Alert Rule Wizard
Url.Abstract: Edit Data Alert Rule Wizard SQL Server Object Type This tab allows you to change the type of SQL Server object that should be monitored by this alert rule. You can generate alerts for objects on currently audited databases and SQL Server instances.

Url.Title: Edit Alert Rule Wizard Additional Event Filters
Url.Abstract: Edit Event Alert Rule Wizard Additional Event Filters This tab allows you to change when the selected event should trigger this alert rule. You can specify more than one condition.

Url.Title: Edit Alert Rule Wizard Alert Actions
Url.Abstract: Edit Event Alert Rule Wizard Alert Actions This tab allows you to change the action you want this alert rule to perform when an audited event matches the specified criteria. Depending on the actions you select, SQL Compliance Manager will write an alert message to the application event log and email it to a specific email address or distribution list. You can use the default alert message or customize it to display the information you need most.

Url.Title: Edit Alert Rule Wizard Finish Alert Rule
Url.Abstract: Edit Event Alert Rule Wizard Finish Alert Rule Use the rule details pane to review your changes, and then click Finish. When you finish this wizard, SQL Compliance Manager applies your changes.

Url.Title: Edit Alert Rule Wizard SQL Server Event Type
Url.Abstract: Edit Event Alert Rule Wizard SQL Server Event Type This tab allows you to change the type of SQL Server event on which you want to alert.

Url.Title: Edit Alert Rule Wizard SQL Server Object Type
Url.Abstract: Edit Event Alert Rule Wizard SQL Server Object Type This tab allows you to change the type of SQL Server object that should be monitored by this alert rule. You can generate alerts for objects on currently audited databases and SQL Server instances.

Url.Title: Edit Event Filter Wizard Finish Event Filter
Url.Abstract: Edit Event Filter Wizard Finish Event Filter Use the filter details pane to review your changes, and then click Finish. When you finish this wizard, SQL Compliance Manager applies your changes.

Url.Title: Edit Event Filter Wizard SQL Server Event Object Type
Url.Abstract: Edit Event Filter Wizard SQL Server Event Object Type This tab allows you to change the type of SQL Server object affected by the filtered event. You can filter events that occur on specific audited databases and SQL Server instances.

Url.Title: Edit Event Filter Wizard SQL Server Event Source
Url.Abstract: Edit Event Filter Wizard SQL Server Event Source This tab allows you to change which user (SQL Server login) or application is initializing the SQL Server event you want to filter from your audit data.

Url.Title: Edit Event Filter Wizard SQL Server Event Type
Url.Abstract: Edit Event Filter Wizard SQL Server Event Type This tab allows you to change the type of SQL Server event you want to filter from your audit data.

Url.Title: Edit Status Alert Wizard Alert Actions
Url.Abstract: Edit Status Alert Wizard Alert Actions This tab allows you to change the action you want this alert rule to perform when the SQL Compliance Manager status matches the specified criteria. Depending on the actions you select, SQL CM will write an alert message to the application event log and email it to a specific email address or distribution list. You can use the default alert message or customize it to display the information you need most.

Url.Title: Edit Status Alert Wizard Finish Status Alert Rule
Url.Abstract: Edit Status Alert Wizard Finish Status Alert Rule Specify a name for the different alert rule, review the rule details, and then click Finish. When you finish this wizard, SQL Compliance Manager applies your changes.

Url.Title: Edit Status Alert Wizard Status Alert Type
Url.Abstract: Edit Status Alert Wizard This tab allows you to change the type of SQL Compliance Manager status you want to alert on.

Url.Title: Alerts Tab
Url.Abstract: Event Alerts Tab This tab allows you to view previously generated Event Alerts. An Event Alert is generated when the Collection Server processes a SQL Server event that matches the alert rule criteria. Use Event Alerts to identify and investigate suspicious activity on specific databases, users, or instances.

Url.Title: Event Filters Tab
Url.Abstract: Event Filters Tab This tab allows you to filter out specific SQL events in the audit data collected from the SQL Server instances and databases you are auditing. Use audit Event Filters to refine your audit data trail so that it contains only the events you need to track.

Url.Title: Event Properties Window Data Change
Url.Abstract: Event Properties Window Data Change This tab allows you to review how column values changed as a result of the selected event.

Url.Title: Event Properties Window Details
Url.Abstract: Event Properties Window Details This tab allows you to view details collected for an individual event.

Url.Title: Event Properties Window General
Url.Abstract: Event Properties Window General This tab allows you to view high-level information about an individual event.

Url.Title: Explore Activity Audited SQL Servers Summary
Url.Abstract: Explore Activity Audited SQL Servers Summary The Audited SQL Servers Summary tab displays the status of audit activity across your SQL Server environment. Use the statistics and graphs on this tab to quickly and easily identify issues so you can continue to ensure the correct level of compliance.

Url.Title: Explore Activity Database Summary
Url.Abstract: Explore Activity Database Summary The SQL Compliance Manager Database Summary tab displays the status of audit activity for a particular database hosted by the selected SQL Server instance. Use the statistics and graphs on this tab to quickly and easily identify database-level issues so you can continue to ensure the correct level of compliance.

Url.Title: Explore Activity Instance Summary
Url.Abstract: Explore Activity Instance Summary The SQL Compliance Manager Instance Summary tab displays the status of audit activity for a particular SQL Server instance in your environment. Use the statistics and graphs on this tab to quickly and easily identify server-level issues so you can continue to ensure the correct level of compliance.

Url.Title: Groom Alerts Now Window
Url.Abstract: Groom Alerts Now Window This window allows you to groom alert messages currently stored in the Repository databases. Grooming permanently deletes any alert message that is older than the age limit you specify.

Url.Title: Groom Audit Data Now Window
Url.Abstract: Groom Audit Data Now Window This window allows you to groom audited events currently stored in the Repository databases. Grooming permanently deletes any event that is older than the age limit you specify. To improve the Collection Server performance while maintaining audit data for later analysis, consider archiving your audit data.

Url.Title: Import Audit Settings Import Audit Settings
Url.Abstract: Import Audit Settings Wizard Import Audit Settings This window allows you to select which type of audit settings you want to import from the selected XML file.

Url.Title: Import Audit Settings Select File to Import
Url.Abstract: Import Audit Settings Wizard Select File to Import This window allows you to specify which audit settings you would like import by selecting the corresponding XML file.

Url.Title: Import Audit Settings Summary
Url.Abstract: Import Audit Settings Wizard Summary This window allows you to choose whether to append or overwrite the existing audit settings for the target SQL Server instance or database.

Url.Title: Import Audit Settings Target Databases
Url.Abstract: Import Audit Settings Wizard Target Databases This window allows you to select which databases you would like to audit using the imported settings.

Url.Title: Import Audit Settings Target Servers
Url.Abstract: Import Audit Settings Wizard Target Servers This window allows you to select which registered SQL Server instances you would like to audit using the imported settings.

Url.Title: Integrity Check Results Window
Url.Abstract: Integrity Check Results Window This window allows you to review the results of your audit data integrity check.

Url.Title: Login Filtering Options Window
Url.Abstract: Login Filtering Options Window This window allows you to set login filtering. Login filtering reduces the number of login events stored in your audit data. When login filtering is enabled, the Collection Server searches the trace files sent by the SQLcompliance Agent for duplicate logins that occurred within the specified time period. Duplicate logins are logins with matching user, application, or host names. The Collection Server consolidates these logins into a single event entry in your audit data.

Url.Title: Login Properties Window Database Access
Url.Abstract: Login Properties Window Database Access This tab allows you to specify access on each Repository database. Use this tab if your environment requires permissions settings that tightly control database access. For example, you can deny access to the Repository databases by default, but grant a login access to a specific Repository database.

Url.Title: Login Properties Window General
Url.Abstract: Login Properties Window General This tab allows you to change the security access and SQL Compliance Manager permissions for the selected SQL Server login.

Url.Title: Manage SQL compliance manager Licenses Window
Url.Abstract: Manage SQL Compliance Manager Licenses Window This window allows you to view details about your SQL compliance manager product license. You can view the following information:

Url.Title: New Data Alert Rule Wizard
Url.Abstract: New Data Alert Rule Wizard Alert Actions This tab allows you to select the action you want this alert rule to perform when an audited data matches the specified criteria. Depending on the actions you select, SQL Compliance Manager writes an alert message to the application event log and email it to a specific email address or distribution list. You can use the default alert message or customize it to display the information you need most.

Url.Title: New Data Alert Rule Wizard
Url.Abstract: New Data Alert Rule Wizard Data Alert Type This tab allows you to start setting up an alert that tracks when someone accesses a sensitive column.

Url.Title: New Data Alert Rule Wizard
Url.Abstract: New Data Alert Rule Finish Alert Rule Specify a name for the new Data Alert rule, review the rule details, and then click Finish. When you finish this wizard, SQL Compliance Manager enables the alert rule and begins applying your alert criteria against audit data associated with the selected objects.

Url.Title: New Data Alert Rule Wizard
Url.Abstract: New Data Alert Rule Wizard SQL Server Object Type This tab allows you to specify the type of SQL Server object that should be monitored by this alert rule. You can generate alerts for objects on currently audited databases and SQL Server instances.

Url.Title: New Alert Rule Wizard Additional Event Filters
Url.Abstract: New Event Alert Rule Wizard Additional Event Filters This tab allows you to define when the selected event should trigger this alert rule. You can specify more than one condition.

Url.Title: New Alert Rule Wizard Alert Actions
Url.Abstract: New Event Alert Rule Wizard Alert Actions This tab allows you to select the action you want this alert rule to perform when an audited event matches the specified criteria. Depending on the actions you select, SQL Compliance Manager writes an alert message to the application event log and email it to a specific email address or distribution list. You can use the default alert message or customize it to display the information you need most.

Url.Title: New Alert Rule Wizard Finish Alert Rule
Url.Abstract: New Event Alert Rule Wizard Finish Alert Rule Specify a name for the new Event Alert rule, review the rule details, and then click Finish. When you finish this wizard, SQL Compliance Manager enables the alert rule and begins applying your alert criteria against audited events associated with the selected objects.

Url.Title: New Alert Rule Wizard SQL Server Event Type
Url.Abstract: New Event Alert Rule Wizard SQL Server Event Type This tab allows you to specify on which type of SQL Server event you want to alert.

Url.Title: New Alert Rule Wizard SQL Server Object Type
Url.Abstract: New Event Alert Rule Wizard SQL Server Object Type This tab allows you to specify the type of SQL Server object that should be monitored by this alert rule. You can generate alerts for objects on currently audited databases and SQL Server instances.

Url.Title: New Event Filter Wizard Finish Event Filter
Url.Abstract: New Event Filter Wizard Finish Event Filter Specify a name for the new event filter, review the filter details, and then click Finish. When you finish this wizard, SQL Compliance Manager enables the event filter and begins applying your filter criteria against audited events associated with the selected objects.

Url.Title: New Event Filter Wizard SQL Server Event Source
Url.Abstract: New Event Filter Wizard SQL Server Event Source This tab allows you to specify which user (SQL Server login) or application is initializing the SQL Server event you want to filter from your audit data.

Url.Title: New Event Filter Wizard SQL Server Event Type
Url.Abstract: New Event Filter Wizard SQL Server Event Type This tab allows you to specify the type of SQL Server event you want to filter from your audit data.

Url.Title: New Event Filter Wizard SQL Server Object Type
Url.Abstract: New Event Filter Wizard SQL Server Object Type This tab allows you to specify the type of SQL Server object affected by the filtered event. You can filter events that occur on specific audited databases and SQL Server instances.

Url.Title: New SQL Server Login Wizard SQL compliance manager Permissions
Url.Abstract: New SQL Server Login Wizard SQL Compliance Manager Permissions This window allows you to specify which level of permissions this login should have within SQL Compliance Manager. A login can configure audit settings, change console security, view audit data, and run reports.

Url.Title: New SQL Server Login Wizard SQL Server Windows Authentication
Url.Abstract: New SQL Server Login Wizard SQL Server Windows Authentication This window allows you to specify which Windows user account should be used when creating the SQL Server login to access SQL Compliance Manager. You can also grant or deny security access to the SQL Server instance that hosts the Repository databases.

Url.Title: New SQL Server Login Wizard Summary
Url.Abstract: New SQL Server Login Wizard Summary Review the provided summary, and then click Finish. When you finish this wizard, SQL Compliance Manager creates a SQL Server login with the specified permissions on the SQL Server instance that hosts the Repository databases.

Url.Title: New Status Alert Wizard
Url.Abstract: New Status Alert Wizard Alert Actions This tab allows you to select the action you want this alert rule to perform when the SQL Compliance Manager status matches the specified criteria. Depending on the actions you select, SQL CM writes an alert message to the application event log and email it to a specific email address or distribution list. You can use the default alert message or customize it to display the information you need most.

Url.Title: New Status Alert Wizard
Url.Abstract: New Status Alert Wizard Finish Status Alert Rule Specify a name for the new alert rule, review the rule details, and then click Finish. When you finish this wizard, SQL Compliance Manager enables the alert rule and begins applying your alert criteria against status updates about the specified product component.

Url.Title: New Status Alert Wizard
Url.Abstract: New Status Alert Wizard Status Alert Type This tab allows you to choose the type of SQL compliance manager status you want to alert on.

Url.Title: Registered SQL Server Properties Window Advanced
Url.Abstract: Registered SQL Server Properties Window Advanced This tab allows you to configure the following settings:

Url.Title: Registered SQL Server Properties Window Audited Activities
Url.Abstract: Registered SQL Server Properties Window Audited Activities This tab allows you to change which types of SQL Server events you want to audit on the selected instance. SQL Compliance Manager audits these events at the server level only.

Url.Title: Registered SQL Server Properties Window Auditing Thresholds
Url.Abstract: Registered SQL Server Properties Window Auditing Thresholds This tab allows you to set auditing thresholds to identify unusual activity on the selected SQL Server instance. SQL Compliance Manager reports threshold violations through the Activity Report Cards on the Summary tabs.

Url.Title: Registered SQL Server Properties Window General
Url.Abstract: Registered SQL Server Properties Window General This tab allows you to change the description of this registered SQL Server instance, and view general properties such as audit settings.

Url.Title: Registered SQL Server Properties Window Privileged User Auditing
Url.Abstract: Registered SQL Server Properties Window Privileged User Auditing This tab allows you to change the audit settings currently applied to privileged users on this SQL Server instance. You can choose to audit event categories and user defined events. An event category includes related SQL Server events that occur at the server level. A user defined event is a custom event you create and track using the sp_trace_generateevent stored procedure.

Url.Title: Registered SQL Servers Tab
Url.Abstract: Registered SQL Servers Tab This tab lists the SQL Server instances that are registered for SQL Compliance Manager to audit. This list includes the following types of registered servers:

Url.Title: Select SQL Server Window
Url.Abstract: Select SQL Server Window This window allows you to select the SQL Server instance you want to register with SQL Compliance Manager. Choose the appropriate instance from the provided list, and then click OK.

Url.Title: Set Maintenance Schedule Window
Url.Abstract: Set Maintenance Schedule Window This window allows you to specify when SQL Compliance Manager should perform maintenance tasks on the Repository, such as rebuilding indexes in the event and archive databases. Because these tasks can be resource-intensive and require extra disk space, consider specifying a time period with slow activity.

Url.Title: Specify Addresses Window
Url.Abstract: Specify Addresses Window This window allows you to specify who should receive an alert email notification. You can specify one or more email addresses for each rule.

Url.Title: Specify Alert Criteria Windows
Url.Abstract: Specify Alert Criteria Windows These windows allow you to use words, phrases, and wildcards to further define your alert rule criteria. For example, you can use this window to find and alert on all databases in your environment that use a naming convention such as dbname01.

Url.Title: Specify Event Filter Criteria Windows
Url.Abstract: Specify Event Filter Criteria Windows These windows allow you to use words, phrases, and wildcards to further define your audit event filter criteria. For example, you can use this window to filter out events that occur on all databases in your environment that use a naming convention such as dbname01.

Url.Title: SQL Logins Tab
Url.Abstract: SQL Logins Tab This tab allows you to manage the SQL Server login accounts associated with the Repository databases. Use this window to configure SQL Server security access and designate permissions within SQL Compliance Manager.

Url.Title: SQLcompliance Agent Properties Window Deployment
Url.Abstract: SQLcompliance Agent Properties Window Deployment This tab allows you to verify how the SQLcompliance Agent was deployed on the selected SQL Server instance. You can view the account used by the SQLcompliance Agent Service as well as the deployment method used.

Url.Title: SQLcompliance Agent Properties Window General
Url.Abstract: SQLcompliance Agent Properties Window General This tab allows you to monitor the health of the SQLcompliance Agent that is auditing the selected SQL Server instance.

Url.Title: SQLcompliance Agent Properties Window SQL Servers
Url.Abstract: SQLcompliance Agent Properties Window SQL Servers This tab allows you to verify which SQL Server instances are currently audited by the SQLcompliance Agent. This list includes instances that are virtual SQL Servers or are running in non-trusted domains and workgroups.

Url.Title: SQLcompliance Agent Properties Window Trace Options
Url.Abstract: SQLcompliance Agent Properties Window Trace Options This tab allows you to configure how the SQLcompliance Agent manages the trace files that contain collected events for auditing.

Url.Title: SQLcompliance Agent Trace Directory Window
Url.Abstract: SQLcompliance Agent Trace Directory Window This window allows you to change the location of the agent trace directory. The SQLcompliance Agent temporarily stores collected SQL Server events in the trace directory until the files can be sent to the Collection Server. To optimize performance, consider specifying a directory that is not located on the local disk drive that hosts the databases of the audited SQL Server instance.

Url.Title: tatus Alerts Tab
Url.Abstract: Status Alerts Tab This tab allows you to view previously generated Status Alerts. A Status Alert is generated when the status of the specified product component matches the alert rule criteria. Use Status Alerts to identify and investigate possible issues with SQL compliance manager operations, such as deployed agents that may have stopped running.

Url.Title: Update Indexes Window
Url.Abstract: Update Indexes Window This window confirms whether you want to update indexes in the selected Repository databases now or later. Updating indexes optimizes performance when viewing and managing event data.

Url.Title: Cluster Configuration Console User Interface
Url.Abstract: Cluster Configuration Console User Interface The SQL Compliance Manager Cluster Configuration online Help provides context-sensitive Help for user interface windows and wizards in the Cluster Configuration Console. For Help on a specific window, expand this section, and then select the appropriate topic. You can also access these window descriptions from the Cluster Configuration Console by pressing F1 or using the ? button.

Url.Title: Add SQLcompliance Agent Service Wizard Collection Server
Url.Abstract: Add SQLcompliance Agent Service Wizard Collection Server This tab lets you to specify which computer is currently hosting the Collection Server. The SQLcompliance Agent Service receives audit settings from the Collection Server and sends collected SQL events to the Collection Server for processing. Ensure the SQLcompliance Agent Service has access to the Collection Server computer.

Url.Title: Add SQLcompliance Agent Service Wizard General
Url.Abstract: Add SQLcompliance Agent Service Wizard General This tab lets you to specify which virtual SQL Server you are planning to audit. The virtual SQL Server is any SQL Server instance hosted by this cluster node. Specifying a virtual SQL Server allows you to begin auditing SQL events generated by activity on this instance. Use the Management Console to specify which server and database events you would like to audit.

Url.Title: Add SQLcompliance Agent Service Wizard SQLcompliance Agent Service Account
Url.Abstract: Add SQLcompliance Agent Service Wizard SQLcompliance Agent Service Account This tab lets you specify the account credentials the SQLcompliance Agent Service account should use to connect to the Collection Server and the virtual SQL Server. The SQLcompliance Agent Service also uses this account to stop and start SQL Server traces, execute stored procedures, and manage trace files. Ensure you specify a valid Windows account that has the following permissions:

Url.Title: Add SQLcompliance Agent Service Wizard SQLcompliance Agent Trace Directory
Url.Abstract: Add SQLcompliance Agent Service Wizard SQLcompliance Agent Trace Directory This tab lets you specify which folder should be used for the SQLcompliance Agent trace directory. The SQLcompliance Agent stores SQL Server trace files in this directory until the files can be sent to the Collection Server for processing. The specified folder must be located on a shared data disk for the specified virtual SQL Server. Ensure you specify the same directory path for each node in the cluster hosting the virtual SQL Server.

Url.Title: Add SQLcompliance Agent Service Wizard
Url.Abstract: Add SQLcompliance Agent Service Wizard CLR Trigger Location This tab lets you specify which folder should be used to store the CLR trigger assembly files required to audit before and after data. These assemblies are created by SQL Compliance Manager when you enable before-after auditing for a specific SQL Server database. The SQLcompliance Agent uses the CLR trigger to collect the before and after values of a database object affected by an audited DML event.

Url.Title: Add SQLcompliance Agent Service Wizard Summary
Url.Abstract: Add SQLcompliance Agent Service Wizard Summary Review the provided summary, and then click Finish. When you finish this wizard, the Cluster Configuration Console installs the SQLcompliance Agent Service on this cluster node.

Url.Title: Cluster Configuration Console Window
Url.Abstract: Cluster Configuration Console Window The Cluster Configuration Console window lets you install and configure the SQLcompliance Agent Service on a cluster node that hosts the virtual SQL Server you want to audit. The cluster node is the physical computer on which you are running the Cluster Configuration Console. When you installed the Cluster Configuration Console, the setup program also installed the SQLcompliance Agent.

Url.Title: SQLcompliance Agent Details Window
Url.Abstract: SQLcompliance Agent Details Window The SQLcompliance Agent Details window lets you view a subset of SQLcompliance Agent properties. To view all properties for the SQLcompliance Agent, use the Management Console.

Url.Title: Specify CLR Trigger Directory Window
Url.Abstract: Specify CLR Trigger Directory Window This window lets you specify which folder should be used to store the CLR trigger assembly files required to audit before and after data. These assemblies are created by SQL Compliance Manager when you enable before-after auditing for a specific SQL Server database. The SQLcompliance Agent uses the CLR trigger to collect the before and after values of a database object affected by an audited DML event.

Url.Title: Upgrade SQL Server in Your Audited Environment
Url.Abstract: Upgrade SQL Server in Your Audited Environment You can choose one of the following SQL Compliance Manager upgrade strategies. Each strategy meets different goals and auditing needs. Before choosing a strategy, review how you intend to deploy a newer version of SQL Server in your audited environment.

Url.Title: Upgrade SQL Server on the Collection Server
Url.Abstract: Upgrade SQL Server on the Collection Server You can upgrade the SQL Server software running on the existing Collection Server when you use your current SQL Compliance Manager installation to audit instances running on multiple versions of SQL Server at the same time in a single environment. Use the following checklist and instructions to successfully upgrade the SQL Server software.

Url.Title: Deploy second Collection Server
Url.Abstract: Deploy second Collection Server Deploy a second Collection Server when you need to audit separate homogeneous environments of SQL Server instances, such as a SQL Server 2005 environment and a SQL Server 2008 environment. For example, you could deploy one Collection Server to dedicated SQL Server 2005 instance in one environment and a second Collection Server to a dedicated SQL Server 2008 instance in another environment. Use the following checklist and instructions to successfully deploy a second Collection Server.

Url.Title: Migrating or Recovering the Collection Server
Url.Abstract: Migrating or Recovering the Collection Server You can execute a migration strategy that addresses one of the following situations:

Url.Title: Prepare for your migration
Url.Abstract: Prepare for your migration A migration strategy moves the Collection Server components to another SQL Server instance, thereby replacing the original Collection Server. You can use a migration strategy to respond to an immediate maintenance need. Use the following procedures and guidelines to implement a new migration strategy or modify an existing migration strategy.

Url.Title: Restore the Repository databases
Url.Abstract: Restore the Repository databases To recover lost or damaged audit data, restore the Repository databases. For best results, use the following guidelines:

Url.Title: Deploy the new Collection Server
Url.Abstract: Deploy the new Collection Server Ensure you review the Collection Server requirements before installing. By default, SQL Compliance Manager installs with a trial license. Update the license key to reflect your current production license.

Url.Title: Configure the SQLcompliance Agent connection
Url.Abstract: Configure the SQLcompliance Agent connection To ensure you successfully continue auditing your registered SQL Servers, configure each SQLcompliance Agent to communicate with the new Collection Server.

Url.Title: How to Audit a Virtual SQL Server Instance
Url.Abstract: How to Audit a Virtual SQL Server Instance SQL Compliance Manager supports auditing a virtual SQL Server instance including the local instance on a cluster running the Collection Server. Use the following checklist to help you deploy and configure SQL Compliance Manager in a clustered environment.

Url.Title: Deploy SQLcompliance Agent to cluster nodes
Url.Abstract: Deploy SQLcompliance Agent to cluster nodes Deploying the SQLcompliance Agent allows you to audit SQL traces written by the virtual SQL Server instance. Complete the following procedure on each cluster node that hosts a virtual SQL Server instance, including the currently active node as well as any passive nodes in the same cluster.

Url.Title: Add SQLcompliance Agent Service
Url.Abstract: Add SQLcompliance Agent Service Adding the SQLcompliance Agent Service allows the SQLcompliance Agent to communicate with the virtual SQL Server instance and the Collection Server. Complete the following procedure on each cluster node that hosts the virtual SQL Server instance, including the currently active node as well as any passive nodes in the same cluster.

Url.Title: Register the SQLcompliance Agent Service
Url.Abstract: Register the SQLcompliance Agent Service Registering the SQLcompliance Agent Service with the Microsoft Cluster Administrator allows the Microsoft Cluster Service to manage the SQLcompliance Agent Service in failover situations. This configuration ensures the SQL trace continues to be audited during a failover and no audit data is lost.

Url.Title: Start auditing the virtual SQL Server
Url.Abstract: Start auditing the virtual SQL Server After you install and configure the SQLcompliance Agent on each node of the Microsoft failover cluster where the virtual SQL Server instance is running, you can test your configuration and begin auditing the instance.

Url.Title: Stop auditing the virtual SQL Server
Url.Abstract: Stop auditing the virtual SQL Server When you decide to stop auditing a virtual SQL Server instance, use the following procedure to remove your configuration settings and uninstall the SQLcompliance Agent.

Url.Title: PDF of SQL Compliance Manager product documentation
Url.Abstract: PDF of SQL Compliance Manager product documentation Use this PDF to print sections of the SQL Compliance Manager product documentation.

Url.Title: Configure Auditing Thresholds to Check for Abnormal Activity Patterns
Url.Abstract: Configure Auditing Thresholds to Check for Abnormal Activity Patterns Configuring auditing thresholds provides you a way to determine whether the amount of audit activity that has occurred over a specified period of time is over your normal operation levels. You can configure thresholds in the following key activity areas:

Url.Title: Console Reports
Url.Abstract: Console Reports SQL compliance manager includes many common audit reports. You can create these reports from within the Management Console. You can select the SQL Server instances, date range, and other report specific criteria to generate reports that meet your needs.

Url.Title: Ensure FIPS compliance
Url.Abstract: Ensure FIPS compliance You can use SQL compliance manager to audit SQL Server databases in environments where Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) compliance is required.

Url.Title: Microsoft Reporting Services Reports
Url.Abstract: Microsoft Reporting Services Reports In addition to allowing you to generate reports from within the Management Console, you can also integrate these reports into Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services (Reporting Services).

Url.Title: Understanding Reports
Url.Abstract: Understanding Reports SQL compliance manager Reports allows you to glean various information and trends from your audit data, such as user activity history and privilege changes on SQL Server objects. This user interface leverages Microsoft Reporting Services, providing secure and easy access to your audit data. Use SQL compliance manager Reports to track compliance on demand and provide self-service reporting to third-party auditors. For more information, see Report on Audit Data.

Url.Title: Understanding the Audit Process
Url.Abstract: Audit process SQL compliance manager audits only the SQL Server instances and associated databases that you specify to audit. For example, you can register a SQL Server instance for auditing but not audit the hosted databases. Likewise, you can audit a single database on a registered SQL Server instance that hosts multiple databases.
